Package org.svvrl.goal.core.logic.re

Class RegularExpression

java.lang.Object
org.svvrl.goal.core.logic.Logic
org.svvrl.goal.core.logic.re.RegularExpression
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable
Direct Known Subclasses:
REAtomic, REConcatenation, REEmpty, REEpsilon, REStar, REUnion
public abstract class RegularExpression
extends Logic
implements java.lang.Cloneable
This class provides an abstraction of ω regular expressions.
Author:
Ming-Hsien Tsai
See Also:
Serialized Form

      public abstract RegularExpression substitute​(Proposition p, RegularExpression q)
      Returns an expression obtained by substituting a regular expression for a proposition in this expression.
      Parameters:
      p - the proposition to be replaced
      q - the replacement of p
      Returns:
      the expression obtained by substituting q for p in this expression

    • substitute

      public abstract RegularExpression substitute​(java.util.Map<Proposition,​RegularExpression> subst)
      Returns an expression obtained by substituting regular expressions for propositions in this expression.
      Parameters:
      subst - a map from a proposition to its replacement
      Returns:
      the expression obtained by replacing the domain of subst with the range of subst in this expression

      this regular expression in the JFLAP format
      Throws:
      UnsupportedException - if this expression cannot be expressed in the JFLAP format

    • fromNFW

      public static RegularExpression fromNFW​(FSA aut)
      Returns a regular expression that is equivalent to a specified classic finite state automaton.
      Parameters:
      aut - a classic finite state automaton
      Returns:
      a regular expression that is equivalent to the specified classic finite state automaton
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the automaton is not a classic finite state automaton
